page.title: 13ST. PETER'S CHURCH HEVERSHAM
page.content: The earliest part of the church was built in ll85 when the building was very small. Some of the original arches are still standing. Over the years many enlargements have been made, the last major extension was about l520. In l60l there was a great fire caused by a workman not extinguishing his fire or torch while mending or servicing the organ when all but the parish chest was destroyed. In l868 there were major restorations and a new tower was added in l868. The church expanded because of a larger population, new services including processions were started, also a choir began, so the size of the building grew.
